Code Quality Analyzer
  • Structural Smell Detection
  • View page source

Structural Smell Detection

The Structural Smell Detector identifies structural issues and complexity problems in Python code.

Detected Smells

  • High Cyclomatic Complexity

  • Deep Inheritance Trees

  • High Coupling (CBO)

  • Low Cohesion (LCOM)

  • Excessive Fan-in/Fan-out

  • Large File Sizes

  • Complex Conditional Structures

Usage

Command Line

analyze_code_quality /path/to/project --type structural

Python API

from code_quality_analyzer import StructuralSmellDetector

detector = StructuralSmellDetector(thresholds)
detector.detect_smells('/path/to/project')
detector.print_report()

API Reference

class code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.StructuralSmellDetector(config)[source]

Bases: object

A class to detect structural smells in Python code.

This class analyzes Python source code files to identify various structural code smells based on predefined thresholds.

structural_smells

A list to store detected structural smells.

Type:

list

class_info

A dictionary to store information about classes.

Type:

defaultdict

module_info

A dictionary to store information about modules.

Type:

defaultdict

dependency_graph

A directed graph to represent module dependencies.

Type:

nx.DiGraph

thresholds

A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

Type:

dict

project_root

The root directory of the project being analyzed.

Type:

str

file_paths

A dictionary to store file paths of modules and classes.

Type:

dict

Initialize the StructuralSmellDetector with given configuration.

Parameters:

config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.

Initialize the StructuralSmellDetector with given configuration.

Parameters:

config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.

Load threshold values from the given configuration.

Parameters:

config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.

Returns:

A dictionary of threshold values.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValueError – If the config is neither a dictionary nor a valid file path.

Analyze a class definition node and extract relevant information.

Analyze a method definition node and extract relevant information.

  • class_name (str) – The name of the class containing the method.

add_smell(name, description, file_path, module_class, line_number=None, severity='medium')[source]

Add a detected structural smell to the list.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the smell

  • description (str) – Description of the smell

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file containing the smell

  • module_class (str) – The module or class containing the smell

  • line_number (int, optional) – The line number where the smell was detected

  • severity (str, optional) – The severity level of the smell (default: ‘medium’)

detect_nom()[source]

Detect classes with a high Number of Methods (NOM).

detect_wmpc()[source]

Detect classes with high Weighted Methods per Class (WMPC).

This method calculates both WMPC1 (based on cyclomatic complexity) and WMPC2 (based on number of parameters) for each class and identifies those exceeding the respective thresholds. Considers method visibility and excludes simple getter/setter methods.

detect_size2()[source]

Detect large classes based on the SIZE2 metric.

This method calculates the SIZE2 metric (sum of methods and fields) for each class and identifies those exceeding the threshold. Considers visibility and usage patterns.

detect_wac()[source]

Detect classes with high Weight of a Class (WAC).

This method counts the number of fields in each class and identifies those exceeding the WAC threshold. Considers field visibility, type, and usage patterns to avoid false positives.

detect_lcom()[source]

Detect classes with high Lack of Cohesion of Methods (LCOM). Uses an improved LCOM calculation that considers: - Method visibility (private/protected/public) - Special methods and properties - Indirect field access through helper methods - Constructor field initialization

_build_field_usage_map(methods, info)[source]

Helper method to build comprehensive field usage map.

detect_rfc()[source]

Detect classes with high Response for a Class (RFC). Enhanced to consider: - Method visibility and importance - External vs internal calls - Framework-specific methods - Standard library calls

detect_nocc()[source]

Detect modules with a high Number of Classes (NOCC). Enhanced to consider: - Class size and complexity - Inner classes - Test classes - Exception classes

detect_dit()[source]

Detect classes with a Deep Inheritance Tree (DIT). Enhanced to consider: - Framework/library base classes - Mixin classes - Interface-like classes - Abstract base classes

detect_loc()[source]

Detect modules with high Lines of Code (LOC).

detect_mpc()[source]

Detect classes with high Message Passing Coupling (MPC). Enhanced to consider: - Method visibility - Call frequency - Standard library calls - Internal vs external coupling - Framework-specific patterns

detect_cbo()[source]

Detect modules with high Coupling Between Object Classes (CBO). Enhanced to consider: - Direct vs indirect coupling - Framework/library dependencies - Test dependencies - Internal vs external coupling - Strength of coupling

_is_excluded_dependency(name, standard_libs, framework_patterns)[source]

Check if a dependency should be excluded from coupling calculations.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name to check.

  • standard_libs (set) – Set of standard library names.

  • framework_patterns (set) – Set of framework-specific patterns.

Returns:

True if the dependency should be excluded, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

_calculate_cbo_severity(weighted_cbo, threshold)[source]

Calculate the severity of a CBO smell based on how much it exceeds the threshold.

Parameters:

  • weighted_cbo (float) – The weighted CBO value.

  • threshold (float) – The CBO threshold.

Returns:

The severity level (‘Low’, ‘Medium’, or ‘High’).

Return type:

str

detect_noc()[source]

Detect projects with a high Number of Classes (NOC). Enhanced to consider: - Class type and purpose - Project size and domain - Test classes - Inner/nested classes - Abstract/interface classes

_adjust_noc_threshold()[source]

Adjust NOC threshold based on project characteristics.

Returns:

Adjusted threshold value

Return type:

float

print_report()[source]

Print a report of all detected structural smells.

resolve_base_class(base_node, module_name)[source]

Resolve the name of a base class from its AST node.

Parameters:

  • base_node – The AST node representing the base class

  • module_name – The name of the module containing the class

Returns:

The resolved base class name

Return type:

str

_get_base_object(node)[source]

Helper method to get the base object name from an attribute node.

detect_cyclomatic_complexity()[source]

Detect methods with high cyclomatic complexity. Uses a simplified calculation based on control flow statements.

calculate_cyclomatic_complexity(method)[source]

Calculate cyclomatic complexity using a simplified approach.

Counts: - if statements - elif branches - for loops - while loops - except blocks - boolean operations (and, or)

Parameters:

method (ast.FunctionDef) – The method to analyze

Returns:

The cyclomatic complexity value

Return type:

int

detect_fanout()[source]

Detect modules with high fan-out (too many outgoing dependencies). Excludes standard library and test dependencies.

detect_fanin()[source]

Detect modules with high fan-in (too many incoming dependencies). Excludes utility classes and base classes which are meant to be widely used.

detect_file_length()[source]

Detect files that are too long.

detect_branches()[source]

Detect methods with too many branches (if/else, loops). Excludes certain types of methods and considers nesting level.

_analyze_branches(method)[source]

Analyze branches in a method, considering both count and nesting level.

Parameters:

method (ast.FunctionDef) – The method to analyze

Returns:

Contains branch count and maximum nesting level

Return type:

dict

code_quality_analyzer.structural_smell_detector.analyze_structure(directory_path, config)[source]

Analyze the structural smells in a given directory.

Parameters:

  • directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to analyze.

  • config (dict or str) – Either a dictionary of thresholds or a path to a YAML config file.
